p: We assume that global temperature is relative to the Greenland Ice Sheet Project (GISP2) ice core paleotemperature proxy data (Grootes, Stuiver, White, Johnsen, & Jouzel, 1993). Proxy data from reconstructing global paleoclimatic temperature in °C were derived from GISP2 δ 18O values (‰; Grootes et al., 1993; Alley, 2000; Alley & Ágústsdóttir, 2005) and were related to average age of the locality. The global temperature anomaly was derived by scaling the GISP2 data to the estimated Last Glacial Maximum temperature, which was on average 6°C colder than the 20th‐century average global temperature.
